meanings.sent1: She only had a few dawds of candy left in her pocket.
meanings.sent2: He found a dawds of change under the sofa cushions.
meanings.sent3: The tiny dawds of paint left were not enough to finish the wall.
meanings.sent4: The dawds of information he provided were not helpful at all.
meanings.sent5: The dawds of sunlight peeking through the clouds gave the room a warm glow.

meanings.definition: Dawds (verb): to waste time or be idle
meanings.sent1: Instead of working, he would dawds around the office all day.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dawds when she should be studying for her exams.
meanings.sent3: He would rather dawds than help with the chores.
meanings.sent4: Time dawds away when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: Don't dawds your opportunities away; seize them while you can.
